greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of functions f:{1,2,...,n}->{1,2,...,n} with exactly k elements x such that |f^(-1)(x)| = 1; n>=0, 0<=k<=n.
comment: Row sums = n^n, all functions f:{1,2,...,n}->{1,2,...,n}.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..140, flattened
formula: E.g.f.: Sum_{k=0..n} T(n,k) * y^k * x^n / n!  = (exp(x) - x + y*x)^n.
maple: b:= proc(t, i, u) option remember; `if`(t=0, 1,
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..10); # _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 13 2013
mathematica: nn = 8; Prepend[CoefficientList[Table[n! Coefficient[Series[(Exp[x] - x + y x)^n, {x, 0, nn}], x^n], {n, 1, nn}], y], {1}] // Flatten
results.author: _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 12 2012
